intro: Phyllodes guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese phyllode, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its unique phyllodes—modified leaf stalks that function as leaves. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, well-drained soils. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine, and it can also serve as a forage plant for livestock. The flowers are usually small and clustered, adding ornamental value to the plant.
